In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if current_line == ""
                current_line = word
            else
                current_line *= " " * word
            end
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)  # append last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

This function splits the input string into words and then iterates over these words. For each word, it checks if adding it to the current line would exceed `text_width`. If it would, the current line is added to the list of lines and a new line is started with the current word. If not, the word is added to the current line. After going through all words, any remaining line is also added to the list of lines.

Here is an example:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
println(wrap_string(s))
```
This would print:
```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing elit.
```
